intro: Mammillaria ruficeps, commonly known as the red-headed nipple cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white to pale green areoles, which bear clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and has a dense, spiny appearance. Its flowers are often tinged with a reddish hue, giving it its common name. Mammillaria ruficeps is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
